sect2.title: Introduction to Aspell
sect2.para: The Aspell package contains an interactive spell checking program and the Aspell libraries. Aspell can either be used as a library or as an independent spell checker.

sect3.title: Additional download(s)
sect3.para: You'll need to download at least one dictionary. The link below will take you to a page containing links to dictionaries in many languages.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Aspell package contains aspell, aspell-import, precat, preunzip, prezip, prezip-bin, pspell-config, run-with-aspell, word-list-compress, filters, dictionaries, compatibility scripts and the libaspell and libpspell libraries.

sect3.title: aspell
sect3.para: aspell is a utility that can function as an ispell -a replacement, as an independent spell checker, as a test utility to test out Aspell features, and as a utility for managing dictionaries.

sect3.title: aspell-import
sect3.para: aspell-import imports old personal dictionaries into Aspell.

sect3.title: precat
sect3.para: precat decompresses a prezipped file to stdout.

sect3.title: prezip
sect3.para: prezip is a prefix delta compressor, used to compress sorted word lists or other similar text files.

sect3.title: prezip-bin
sect3.para: prezip-bin is called by the various wrapper scripts to perform the actual compressing and decompressing.

sect3.title: pspell-config
sect3.para: pspell-config displays information about the libpspell installation, mostly for use in build scripts.

sect3.title: run-with-aspell
sect3.para: run-with-aspell is a script to help use Aspell as an ispell replacement.

sect3.title: word-list-compress
sect3.para: word-list-compress compresses or decompresses sorted word lists for use with the Aspell spell checker.

sect3.title: aspell libraries
sect3.para: The lib{a,p}spell libraries are spell checking library interfaces.
